title: Writing
text:
Before my teaching career, I worked in a few jobs that allowed me to write for the web. All of these articles (and one project!) live in various corners of the internet, linked below.

Digital history / data viz


As a grad student I created a project applying various digital humanities tools and approaches to do a “distant reading” of slave narratives in UNC’s “Documenting the American South” online library.


Topic Modeling Equiano and the Slave Narrative Genre



Harvard Kennedy School
When I worked at the Kennedy School’s Ash Center for Democratic Governance and Innovation as a research assistant and writer for the Project on Municipal Innovation, I occasionally wrote for the Ash Center’s own website and other outlets, like Governing.

From Comment Cards to Sentiment Mining
With Form Comes Function
Managing for the Soul of the City
Regulating Rideshares
Stretch Goals

I also contributed reporting and writing to a few chapters in The Responsive City. And I designed the cover!


Harvard Gazette
When I worked for Harvard’s office of Public Affairs & Communications, I had the opportunity to write a few stories for the Harvard Gazette, mostly on the arts and culture beat.

Where art blends with activism
Sweeping gestures, divine power
An art exhibit replete with diversity
Snapshots of the past
A measure of redemption
Award honors beloved mentor

title: About Me
text:
Hello, I’m Matt McClellan. I’m a high-school English teacher living in Central Oregon.
From 2016 through 2023 I taught in the Bay Area. Outside of school, I enjoyed participating in the soccer program at San Quentin State Prison. Check out the San Quentin News and listen to Ear Hustle to learn more about sports and life inside the prison.
Before my teaching career, I spent my whole life (except a one-year sojourn to Santa Barbara) in the Boston area. In a past life I worked in admin at Harvard and lived in glamorous Somerville, MA.

title: Quarto digital garden
text:
This is a post that will house notes on my experience learning to use Quarto.
